section.title: Wireless Networks
section.para: For a desktop installation using NetworkManager (e.g., GNOME), you just have to make sure the user is in the networkmanager group and you can skip the rest of this section on wireless networks.

If you are using WPA2 the wpa_passphrase tool might be useful to generate the wpa_supplicant.conf.
# wpa_passphrase ESSID PSK > /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf
After you have edited the wpa_supplicant.conf, you need to restart the wpa_supplicant service.
# systemctl restart wpa_supplicant.service
